AV1 Guide

This page documents AV1-specific encoding with Zencoder. This is a beta release as AV1 codec itself is relatively new and being improved everyday.

AV1 Overview

  • AV1 is an open, royalty-free, next-generation video encoding format from the Alliance of Open Media Video. It can deliver superior quality at significantly lower bitrates compared to HEVC, VP9 and H.264 codecs.
  • Support for AV1 codec is available to all Zencoder customers.
    â€œNote: If you are a customer with a Premium account or with a contract and you are looking to try AV1, reach out to your Customer Success Manager to have this codec enabled in your account.
  • Currently mp4 and webm containers are supported with AV1 codec.
  • As AV1 popularity and usage increases, new features and containers are added by the Alliance of Open Media. We will be adding new features in the future as they are available.
  • See the list of limitations for more information.

Specific Options

  • video_codec_level: constrains the bitrate and coding tree units (CTUs).

    Valid values (see this article for the specific output values associated with these values):

    • 2.0
    • 2.1
    • 3.0
    • 3.1
    • 4.0
    • 4.1
    • 5.0
    • 5.1
    • 5.2
    • 5.3
    • 6.0
    • 6.1
    • 6.2
    • 6.3
  • video_codec_profile: sets the encoding profile. The currently supported AV1 profiles are: main, high and professional. Default: main.

Limitations

The following are current limitations to AV1 outputs.

  • All AV1 encoding are currently single pass only.
  • Segmented / Fragmented streaming file outputs are not supported yet by AV1.
  • The following settings are not supported:
    • video_bframes
    • video_reference_frames
    • decoder_bitrate_cap (decoder_buffer_size is supported)
    • max_video_bitrate
    • quality
    • crf
    • Resolutions that are not multiple of 8 (width and height)
